pullRequest.title: [shelly]Enhancements and bug fixes
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR includes all changes from #6592 and replaces it. PR #6592 has been closed.
Signed-off-by: markus7017 markus7017@gmail.com

commit.message:
This is derived from PR #6592 - to get a clean status I open ths new
PR

Signed-off-by: markus7017 <markus7017@gmail.com>

Remove brightsnessAutoOn from non-light things; PREPARING 2.5.1 final

Signed-off-by: markus7017 <markus7017@gmail.com>

FTR #6879: Temp sensors for Shelly 1/1PM added

Signed-off-by: Markus Michels <markus7017@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: Why did you remove this line?
Why did you remove the message from the Thing status? The Thing status is the correct place for it.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -39,8 +45,71 @@
 			<label>Enable Push Events (short/long)</label>
 			<description>True if the binding should register to get the Short/Long Push Events.</description>
 			<advanced>true</advanced>
+			<default>false</default>
+		</parameter>
+		<parameter name="eventsCoIoT" type="boolean" required="false">
+			<label>Enable CoIoT Events</label>
+			<description>If enabled the Coap protocol will be used to receive status updates.</description>
+			<advanced>true</advanced>
+			<default>false</default>
+		</parameter>
+		<parameter name="updateInterval" type="integer" required="true">
+			<label>Update Interval</label>
+			<description>Interval in seconds to query an update from the device.</description>
+			<default>60</default>
+			<unitLabel>sec</unitLabel>

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            			<description>If enabled the Coap protocol will be used to receive status updates.</description>
          
          
            
            			<description>If enabled, the CoAP protocol is used to receive status updates.</description>

nodes.bodyText:
This feature does imho not make much sense in a binding - it is not at all specific here.
If a user wishes such an alarm, wouldn't it be hundred times better to have the alarm cover ALL devices that report their signal strength and not just the Shelly ones? This hence belongs into a rule and not in a binding.

 			<description>IP-Address of the Shelly device.</description>
 			<context>network-address</context>
 		</parameter>
+		<parameter name="weakSignal" type="integer" required="false">
+			<label>Weak Signal Threshold</label>
+			<description>An alarm is triggered if a device reports WiFi signal strength below this threshold. Default: -80 dBm</description>

@@ -39,8 +45,71 @@

 			<description>True if the binding should register to get the Short/Long Push Events.</description>

nodes.bodyText:
No, please don't add such debugging channels to the Things, this really feels not right.
Doing debug level logging should normally be enough. If you really want it somewhere else, maybe it would be ok to add it as Thing properties.

commit.message:
Change requests from PR review; #6949 Fix for color updates via Coap;
Fix for #6950 Updating input states via Coap - both fixes need to be
verified.

Signed-off-by: Markus Michels <markus7017@gmail.com>

property updated fixed

Signed-off-by: Markus Michels <markus7017@gmail.com>

some more debugging on HttpUtil exception, ext. temp sensor channels
marked as advanced; Typos in properties corrected

Signed-off-by: Markus Michels <markus7017@gmail.com>

Set initial status to UNKNOWN rather than keeping INITIALIZING

Signed-off-by: Markus Michels <markus7017@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText:
Why do you have to suppress unused? Can't you simply remove unused variables?
Also, please try to avoid null suppressions and rather refactor the code to be fully null-safe.
Ok, if you address this in a future PR, no blocker wrt merging now.

commit.message:
alarm type WAEK_SIGNAL removed as requested by review

Signed-off-by: Markus Michels <markus7017@gmail.com>

cleanup of removed channels
